page.title: Who builds our brand?
page.param: page/ab0100101a.swf|page/ab_forward01f.swf
true
page/ab0100101f.swf

Have you ever looked closely at a picture, close enough that your nose touches the image? What do you see? You start to see the individual elements that make up the picture. You see the individual brush strokes in a painting. The pixilation of a TV screen or a computer monitor. And the closer you look the more you notice the smaller points become bigger. But then you step away and realize the points are surrounded by thousands of other points. Small, but not insignificant. Working together to create the bigger picture. American Century Investments is made up of thousands of points like these and every employee has the opportunity to influence each touchpoint, everyday. An investor, a recruit, an advisor or client may encounter American Century Investments in many ways. Every time an employee answers the phone, when an investor walks into the lobby of our building, even through a TV ad. And every time an investor comes in contact with our company, he or she forms an opinion about who we are and determines if we're right for them. In short, our big picture. Our big picture will only be clear by projecting a unified image at every touchpoint. And every touchpoint, no matter how small, contributes to the big picture.

Thank you for taking the time to discover more about our big picture. More about American Century Investments. Let's begin by answering, what is a brand? Why is it important? What is our brand vision? Go ahead and click on Definition to begin.
Definition. Brand is defined as a collection of perceptions about what our company does, what we stand for, what we value, what we look like and why customers should do business with us.
Click Forward to continue.....

page.param: video/ab0100203v.swf|video/ab0100301v.swf

page/ab0100301f.swf
So why is this collection of perceptions so important? Click on Benefits to find out.

Benefits. Focusing all our efforts on a single, big picture helps our company on many levels. When an investor or client recognizes the strength of American Century Investments it makes it easier to introduce new products and services and maximizes the efficiency of communications spending. Being consistent in who we are and what we stand for creates a strong brand in the minds of investors. And research has proven time and again that consumers are loyal to strong brands. The ability to be consistent in what we do and say, doing the right things for our investors and clients is so important to our company it is a part of Our Path to Success.
Click Forward to continue.....

page.title: What is brand?
page.param: video/ab0100302v.swf|video/ab0100401v.swf

Click on Vision to learn more.

Vision. So back to the big picture... How do we ensure that every touchpoint reinforces who we are? First we need to articulate it. We use what we call the brand vision to do that. Our brand vision is to be the premier investment manager for people who believe in doing well and doing good. This is the idea we want American Century Investments to stand for in the minds of our investors, peers, business partners, our community and each other. Who we are - a premier investment manager; who are we for - people who believe in doing well and doing good. And when every touchpoint in the big picture resonates with our vision, no matter how large or small, the image we present will be clear and unified.
Now that you know what a our brand vision is and why it's important, click forward to discover ways you can bring our brand to life.
Congratulations! You have completed Module 1. Click Forward to continue.....

page.title: Doing Well Doing Good
page.param: video/ab0200101v.swf|page/ab_forward01f.swf
true
page/ab0200101f.swf

Let's talk about “doing well and doing good.” Our investors and clients expect results. So, we've made our sole business focus to grow the assets they entrust to us. That's doing well for investors and clients. But it's not just results, but how we achieve them that also matters. Guided by the values of our founder, Mr. Stowers, investors and clients can count on our commitment to their success. We have a track record of integrity. We are optimistic about the future and the good that money can do in the world around us. That's doing good for our investors and clients. How can they be sure? Mr. Stowers provides the ultimate example. He founded American Century Investments to help improve people’s financial position. Today he and his wife, Virginia, have translated that success into helping improve lives through the Stowers Institute for Medical Research. Mr. Stowers said it best... “The people of American Century Investments have always understood that you invest more than your money with us—you place a piece of your future in our hands. We believe you place such enormous trust in us because we are guided by values that you share.” James Stowers, Jr., Founder

page.title: Our Personality
page.param: false
page/ab0200601f.swf

We've talked about who we are and who we are for, our vision of American Century Investments. Let's also talk about how, like a person, a company has a personality. For example, they may be adventurous, thoughtful, driven or a combination of these and other characteristics. These traits influence how they behave and how they are seen. A company's personality can be characterized in much the same way and can positively impact customer experiences and perceptions. When American Century Investments is at its best, our personality is captured in these three words: Focused, Committed and Optimistic. We exhibit many other characteristics, but we believe these three are the most accurate and relevant. These are the traits that guide how we make decisions, what we look like, how we communicate.

Our sole business is to manage money. We are investment specialists, hire the best people and employ highly defined, consistently applied, repeatable processes to achieve results. Our investor and clients selected a firm that takes no shortcuts and leaves little to chance.

In an industry that thrives on numbers... we haven't lost site of our roots, our founding principle to enrich the lives of our investors by improving their financial position. Our reputation is built on honesty, integrity and determination. Our Guiding Principles serve as the foundation for everything we do from the way we treat our investors to our comprehensive benefits package to our commitment to community service. It is the reason that Fortune consistently names us one of the best places to work. Investors and clients can count on us to do the right thing for them and their money.

We are confident and expect the best possible outcomes. As our founder Jim Stowers, Jr. often reminds us, “The best is yet to be.” Through our actions we are creating a brighter future for the people who are an integral part of our company – employees, investors and clients alike. We take a proactive approach to investing that is based on a disciplined investment process and a team management approach. This active management style enables us to find relevant investment opportunities in every market cycle. Our investors and clients can feel prepared, ready for what is next; confident about the future. While no one can make promises about the market, our investors and clients can be assured that we are working hard on their behalf for the best long-term results.

We just described how the company exemplifies these traits, but that is only part of the picture. Each of us has the opportunity to bring focus, commitment and optimism to the work we do everyday, our individual contribution to the big picture. How are you focused? Committed? Or Optimistic in your role at American Century Investments. Click on resources to print off a worksheet to capture your thoughts. Share it with your manager or take it to your next team meeting to discuss with co-workers.

What about Lance Armstrong? What is his role in the big picture? Well, Lance Armstrong is a visible expression of our vision. He will serve as a motivating force to inspire investors to take a more active role in planning for their financial future. His image is an example of someone who has done well (achieved results) and is doing good (inspiring and empowering people affected by cancer). Lance will appear in advertising and marketing efforts designed to convey the vision: American Century Investments is the premier investment manager for people who believe in doing well and doing good. Through these communications we intend to build our brand awareness with investors and clients who may not know us today.

We assess how American Century Investments is perceived among individual investors, investment professionals and institutional professionals.
